children: ^You jump to the system and immediately the defense matrix detects several thousand turbo atomic missiles suddenly bearing towards you. It's a speed at which you can easily maneuvre, a laughable speed really. Whoever deployed these weapons had a pitiful grasp of the grand theory of Newtonian quantum metaphysics.
^A comm from a beacon broadcasts a signal.
contact: ^You engage in full dialogue with the beacon comms.
^%%This planet was designated a human growth world. One of thousands. Genetic hyper intelligence serum was deployed along side a foundational colony of humans.
^%%Contact with the colony ceased immediately after impact. I have waited here for so long.
^%%Please sentient one. End my existence that I might sleep.
^Close the comm. Let the beacon AI suffer for a few more millennia
close: ^An act of utter cruelty. Perhaps another sojourning party will provide mercy or perhaps the AI will writhe in solitude for an unimaginable length of time. We'll never know.
destroy: ^Compassionately, you offer the AI a merciful end. With a flick of the wrist you command an underhand to vaporise the beacon in whatever manner they deem fit.
planet: ^Right, let's open this can of human worms.
^You send a search dirigible down to the planet to initiate first contact with the humans.
pigs: ^At the colony ship they find a type 1 civilisation of hyper intelligent porcine beings. They are pretty close to what we might call pigs.
talk: ^You initiate contact with the pigfolk. That's not what the call themselves but for the sake of simplicity, let's stick with it.
^Their leader - a large pig called 'Napoleon' invites you to the surface, and their sheer weakness and lack of threat, combined with mild intrigue compels you to join him on the surface.

^After landing, Napoleon approaches you with a retinue of his own. 'Greetings human. Our kind have been separated by countless eons. We hope to establish friendly relations with your kind and bid to join you in exploring the stars'
^So, what happened to the humans of the colony ship
^I've got bad news for you about the future of our shared galaxy
future: ^You explain to Napoleon that the galaxy is in decline. That humanity have spread far and wide, plundering the galactic resources and that collapse is all but imminent. Collapse followed by regression.
^He ponders this and demands to know your goals.
^First, what happened to the colony ship?
disguise: ^We seek only to trade and offer transport to your people to more hospitable and friendly worlds.
^Napoleon sees through your lies easily and attempts to flee in panic, his retinue covering with a paltry fire of ancient weapons.
humans: ^'Truthfully, we are not certain. Although what seems to have happened is that the enhance humans or humans who consumed the hyper intelligence serum - died for some reason unknown to us.
^Our ancestors, it seems were brought as a form of sustenance and in a cruel twist of fate, consumed the humans or their remains and as a byproduct, the intelligence boosting serum.
^Regaining his composure, he attempts to ascertain your intent.
^'What is your goal here if I may be so bold?'
^It seems that you have a number of ways forward.
bacon: ^You command your men to wipe out the pigfolk.
^Your superior weapons and preparedness for combat ensures that the task is trivial.
^You manage to corner a mortally wounded Napoleon. He looks at you in confused anguish.
calories: ^It is simply a matter of taste my friend. Your kind were sustenance for my kind for untold years but with cloning and genetic tweaking, something has been lost to that original ... flavour.
^I intend to have you all cloned and farmed for meat so that modern humans might enjoy a few final tastes to shares with their forebears.
^You lift a detached and seared limb from nearby and take a monstrous bite.
^Napoleon looks at you in horror as he takes his final breath, for this lifetime.
^Wrap it up and return to the ship
tell: ^'We were here to rescue any remaining humans. As there are none here, we have no reason to be here.
^I should warn you that the forest is dark and that if you continue to push to the stars. You will be swiftly and totally admonished.'
^The pigfolk look taken aback somewhat and scramble to oink among one another in a huddle as you commence leaving procedures.
^As you take one step onto your dirigible, a piercing squeal pierces the air.
pigwar: ^'We wish to join you on your journey. Take us with you, or at least let us discuss the galactic turmoil. We can provide insights you may not have considered.'
no: ^'Humans will not tolerate sharing our ship with you. Our course is set for the void. Your existence would only provoke conflict.'
^You board the dirigible and take off back to the ship.
^You suddenly hear the thud of trotters against the hull and spy pigfolk cutting their way in.
^You blast the first pig to enter, then another. Guards make short work of most of the boarders.
continue: ^One crewman near an opening, experiences an issue with his weapon. A pig gets near him and injects him with something before you personally turn it into a delicious smelling vapour.
^The crewman stands, grunting - 'The pigs, they understand how to resolve... everything. If we just' BLAM.
^You put a vapor-round through his skull.
^Despite their intelligence, they are no match for your superior weapons and before long. The boarders are repelled.
^Should have roasted this planet the moment we arrived
leave: ^There's so much hassle handling colonised planets with no contact. Do you merge them into the ship, do you help them with tech? Will they be angry? Will they be hostile? Who has the time. Leave them to it.

^pigs consumed them and in turn the growth hormone
^pigs attempt to board the ship successfully
